snippet: Last year, the Tallahassee police’s handling of a rape accusation against Jameis Winston drew attention to its failure to adequately investigate. Now, an examination shows a pattern to the handling of such complaints.
abstract: Examination of sexual assault complaints by Florida State University students shows pattern in which Tallahassee and university police dropped cases if victims did not explicitly ask police to investigate; experts say what happens in Tallahassee is common, although police forces are being encouraged to alter their habits.

byline.original: By RICHARD PÉREZ-PEÑA and WALT BOGDANICH

lead_paragraph: Last year, the Tallahassee police’s handling of a rape accusation against Jameis Winston drew attention to its failure to adequately investigate. Now, an examination shows a pattern to the handling of such complaints.

headline.main: In Florida Student Assaults, an Added Burden on Accusers
headline.print_headline: In Florida Student Assaults, an Added Burden on Accusers
